arm_group.description: chest physiotherapy in patient's bed, including deep breathing, directed cough, arm movment and more.
This patients will not recive chest physiotherapy after extubation, unless developing respiratory deterioration

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to examine the efficacy of chest physiotheray treatment in
      preventing pulmonary complications and weaning faliure, in extubated critically ill
      patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post Extubation Chest Physiotherapy in ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:ICU patients, over 18 years' old, mechanical ventilated over 24 hours,
        candidates for extubation -

        Exclusion Criteria: Mental conditions, retardation, dementia, pregnancy, re-intubated
        patients

        -

intervention.description: chest physiotherapy, up to one hour from extubation, in ICU patients

facility.name: Intensive Care Unit, Rambam Health Care Campus

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Post Extubation Chest Physiotherapy on Respiratory Complications and Weaning Failure in Critically Ill Patients

oversight_info.authority: Israel: The Israel National Institute for Health Policy Research and Health Services Research

primary_outcome.description: re-intubation up to 48 hours post extubation will be considered a weaning failure

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
